question:
Recently, government launched phase-II of the flagship UDAN (Ude Desh Ka Aam Nagrik) scheme. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. It is an initiative to make air travel cheaper to India’s tier II and tier III cities
  2. Airlines are required to bid for exclusive rights to operate on the regional routes opened up under the scheme
  3. Government is providing financial support to this scheme in the form of Viability Gap Funding
  4. Uttarakhand state received the maximum number of airports and helipads under phase-II of the scheme
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: UDAN (Ude Desh Ka Aam Nagrik) is the Government’s initiative to make air travel cheaper for aam aadmi. Under this scheme, government aims to provide India’s tier II and tier III with easy and cheap flight connectivity. To make it viable for aviation sector as well as for people of remote locations, government is providing financial support to scheme through Viability Gap Funding. Airlines are required to bid for exclusive rights to fly on the regional routes opened up under the scheme. The scheme makes it compulsory for them to sell a specific number of seats on each flight at a fixed fare of 2,500 for one hour of flying. In the case of helicopter operations, allowed for the first time now, fares are capped at 2,500 for a 30-minute flight. The government recently launched phase-II of the scheme. Under phase-II, the States with maximum number of airports and helipads which will see activation under UDAN 2 scheme include Uttarakhand (15), Uttar Pradesh (9), Arunachal Pradesh (8), Himachal Pradesh (6), Assam (5) and Manipur (5).
